clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of the Mass Skiers' Injury in a Large Ski Resort in Chongli, China
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of the Mass Skiers' Injury in a Large Ski Resort in Chongli, China

brief_summary.textblock: This study takes the injury situation of a large ski resort in Chongli during the 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 snow seasons as an example, aiming to preliminarily understand the injury situation of mass skiing in ski resorts in China, and provide a basis for predicting the rapidly growing medical demand for treatment and treatment of ski injuries in the context of 2022 Winter Olympic Games.

detailed_description.textblock:
Objective: To make a retrospective analysis of the injuries of skiing population in a large ski resort in Chongli, China and provide a basis for predicting the rapidly increasing medical needs for ski injuries in the context of the 2022 winter Olympic Games.
Methods: The basic data of all injured skiers who were treated in a medical station of a large ski resort in Chongli during the 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 snow seasons were collected. The number of skiers, the number of injuries, the causes of injuries, the types of injuries and the locations of injuries were compared.

primary_outcome.measure: Injury rate during the snow season
primary_outcome.time_frame: Injury rate during a snow season,an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: This study statistically analyzed the injury rates of the two snow seasons to see if there was any difference

arm_group.description: Injured skiers in the 2017-2018 snow season
Injured skiers in the 2018-2019 snow season

intervention.description: We classified skiers in the two snow seasons by injury site, type of injury, cause of injury, etc

study_pop.textblock: During the 2017-2018 and 2018-2019 snow season, the injured skiers were amateurs.There were teenagers and teachers.But most of them were young and middle-aged.
